And you slowly add noise to them,<eob>
where you get to essentially a fully random image. <eob>
But you have all of these samples.<eob>
And then the goal of diffusion models is you're trying<eol> to learn the reverse process. <eob>
You're basically trying to figure out,<eol> from a random sample, <eob>
can I get back to one step at a time,<eol> can I get back to some high quality image? <eob>
And if there's no other information,<eob>
it'll just come back to something<eol> that's high quality. <eob>

it's a stochastic process,<eob>

or realizations of the process. <eob>

everything you need to know to figure out what's coming<eol> next is in the last sample. <eob>
